alert.note: Alert for Northern Grafton; Southern Grafton; Sullivan (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 5:19PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Sullivan and southwestern Grafton Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 519 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Woodstock Village, or near Woodstock, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lebanon, Grafton, Hanover, Enfield, Canaan, Groton, Piermont, Grantham, Lyme, Cornish, Dorchester, Ellsworth, Wentworth, Plainfield, Rumney, Orange and Orford. This includes Interstate 89 between mile markers 46 and 60. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
